title: F-LNG2 forward validation: organic vs triggered corrections S313-S327
hypothesis: Organic correction rate remains low (< 0.5/10s) at high-K (>40k), consistent with S312 retrospective finding of 0.21/10s

events.notes: L-433: P-182 confidence upgrade (cross-substrate evidence) — organic meta-insight
F-LNG1 stall detection; F-LNG2 this analysis

forward_rates.note: The 1 organic event (L-433) is a confidence upgrade (THEORIZED->cross-substrate), not a direction correction. If excluding upgrades: organic_rate = 0.0/10s

verdict: CONSISTENT with F-LNG2 prediction. Organic correction rate 0-2/10s in high-K zone (predicted: 0.21/10s). Triggered corrections dominate (80% of events = audit-triggered). Sample n=5 sessions is small but directionally confirms S312 finding.
open: (1) Extend to 10+ sessions for stronger power
(2) Test: does compaction event (F105) re-open organic correction window?
(3) Distinction: confidence-upgrade (organic) vs direction-correction (audit) as separate metrics
